subject: Programming
title: Error Handling
description: A quick win: understand Error Handling.

hook.text: Happy path code is easy. The real complexity lives in what happens when things go wrong.

buildup.text: Returning error codes forces callers to check immediately. Miss one and bugs hide silently.

discovery.text: Exceptions separate the happy path from error handling, keeping the main logic clean.

twist.text: Catching too broadly swallows important errors. 'catch (Exception e)' hides real problems.

climax.text: Good error handling is specific, informative, and never silent. Fail loudly or fix quietly.

quiz.question: Why are exceptions preferred over error codes?
options: They separate happy path from error handling
